name: Differences between adjacent terms of A076467 that correspond to the locations of abc-quality records of A378164.
comment: See A378164 for more information and examples.
author: _Hugo Pfoertner_, Nov 19 2024

name: Smaller of consecutive terms b < c of A076467 such that the quality q=log(rad(c))/log(rad((c-b)*b*c)) of the abc-triple c-b,b,c with gcd(c-b,b,c)=1 sets a new record.
program: (PARI) \\ Uses _M. F. Hasler_'s A076467_vec from A076467

a378164_5(upto) = {my(W=A076467_vec(upto), qw=0); for(k=2, #W, my(d=W[k]-W[k-1]); if(gcd([d,W[k],W[k-1]])==1, my(C=factor(W[k])[,1], B=factor(W[k-1])[,1], A=factor(d)[,1], P=vecprod(setunion(setunion(Set(B),Set(C)),Set(A))), q=log(vecprod(C))/log(P)); if(q>qw, print([d,W[k-1],W[k],q]); qw=q)))};
xref: A378165 gives the corresponding values of c-b.
author: _Hugo Pfoertner_, Nov 18 2024

name: Terms c = A076467(k) such that the distinct prime factors of b = A076467(k-1) and of c-b are subsets of the prime factors of c, i.e., rad(c)/rad((c-b)*b*c) = 1.
example: Pairs b,c of consecutive terms of A076467
program: (PARI) \\ Uses _M. F. Hasler_'s A076467_vec from A076467
a378166_7(upto) = {my(W=A076467_vec(upto)); for(k=2, #W, my(d=W[k]-W[k-1], q=rad(W[k])/rad(W[k]*W[k-1]*d)); if(q==1, print([d, W[k-1], W[k]])))};
\\ Alternative program not using rad, more efficient

a378166_7(upto) = {my(W=A076467_vec(upto)); for(k=2, #W, my(C=Set(factor(W[k])[,1]), d=W[k]-W[k-1]); if(#setminus(Set(factor(d)[,1]), C)>0, , if(#setminus(Set(factor(W[k-1])[,1]), C)==0, print([d, W[k-1], W[k]]))))};
xref: A378167 gives the corresponding values of c-b.
author: _Hugo Pfoertner_, Nov 20 2024

name: Differences between adjacent terms of A076467 that correspond to the locations described by A378166.
comment: See A378166 for more information and examples.
author: _Hugo Pfoertner_, Nov 20 2024
